titlestmt.titleproper: Indiana University Population Institute for Research and Training records, 1953-2002 C559
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to the Records at the Indiana University Archives
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Abi Parker

note.p: © 2015 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-04 05:11:21 -0500.

did.unittitle: Indiana University Population Institute for Research and Training records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University, Blooomington. Population Institute for Research and Training.

did.abstract: The Population Institute for Research and Training was founded at Indiana University in 1986 as a center for interdisciplinary population studies. The Center's purpose was to facilitate research and training activities related to demography including courses, seminars, and research projects. This collection contains administrative files, information on courses and seminars, and various working papers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Population Institute for Research and Training (PIRT) was founded at Indiana University in 1986 as a center for interdisciplinary population studies. The Institute was involved in collecting data resources related to demography, facilitating and supporting research projects, developing and publishing an ongoing working papers series, and offering courses and seminars related to demography. Through PIRT, PhD students could pursue a Minor Field in Population Studies.
The Center closed after Director George Alter retired in 2007.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: Administrative files (1980-2002), Courses and seminars (1977-2001), and Research (1953-2002).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is organized into three series, each arranged in alphabetical order by folder label: Administrative files (1980-2002), Courses and seminars (1977-2001), and Research (1953-2002).

The Administrative files series contains records related to PIRT's various activities, including grant and fellowship information as well as planning files for two conferences: the Cause of Death Conference and the Eurasia Conference. Records span 1980 through 2002.

The next series, Courses and seminars, spans 1977-2001 and consists of records related to the various courses and seminars associated with PIRT such as International Perspectives on Population Problems; Family, Household, and Gender, and Economic Development & Growth. The files include seminar announcements and outlines, course syllabi, and curriculum information for the PhD Minor Field in Population Studies.

The final series, Research, 1953-2002, contains records of research activities supported by PIRT and includes the Cause of Death papers published in a special issue of Journal of the History of Medicine and Allied Sciences, and the papers of the Fertility Working Group. The majority of this series consists of records documenting the ongoing working papers series published by PIRT.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory.
Archived web sites for the Institute may be included in Archive-It.
Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Population Institute for Research and Training records, Collection C559, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.
